item.title: Motorsport Games Stock Falls Below $1 As Questions Mount
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/motorsport-games-stock-falls-below-1-as-questions-mount/

Motorsport Games is officially a penny stock. At 9:50am ET, the company’s stock was trading at less than $1 on the NASDAQ. The stock has sense rebounded back above $1 as of publishing, but it remains in flux.

The stock has fallen over 7% over the last five days. Looking back a bit further, it has fallen by nearly 20% since the company reported its 2024 fourth quarter earnings on March 21.

Reasons for the stocks falling are multiple. Not only is the United States market a volatile place right now, but Motorsport Games has seen its value drop over the last couple of years. The company has lost both its Indy Car and NASCAR licenses, and currently only develops one game: Le Mans Ultimate.

It’s worth mentioning that the game has sold more than 100,000 copies since it released in early access in February 2024. However, the company itself is still losing millions of dollars per quarter, reporting a fourth quarter loss of $2.9 million. This comes despite the company increasing its revenue for 2024 by 25.7% ($8.7 million) compared to 2023 ($6.9 million).

Motorsport Games also has, as of February 28, 2025, $1.2 million in cash and cash equivalents on hand. With the limited amount of funds, the company said in its recent earnings report that it didn’t believe it had “sufficient cash on hand to fund its operations over the next year”.

Insider Gaming understands that the company has continued to have multiple discussions regarding either a complete buyout or, at the very least, the selling of more assets. Those talks, however, have not resulted in any known finalized deal as of publishing.

What do you think of Motorsport Games’ stock continuing to fall? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read our exclusive on the internal memo from Ubisoft detailing the company’s “plan” for its new subsidiary company. And don’t forget to sign up for the Insider Gaming newsletter.

item.title: All Games Announced During the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-games-announced-during-the-nintendo-switch-2-direct/

The Nintendo Switch 2 Direct delivered many of the details and features fans were expecting, and of course a wide collection of different games. While the brand new games announced for the new handheld console were the major highlights, there were all sorts of games that got players excited.

In addition to new games for the Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo also announced a collection of original Switch games will be “enhanced” for the Switch 2. The company also announced a number of Gamecube games will be added to the Nintendo Switch Online catalog.

Here are all the games that were announced at the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct.

Nintendo Switch 2 Games

Here are the new games that were announced for the Nintendo Switch 2, either as launch titles or future releases. This list includes first-party Nintendo titles and third-party games. Games listed without a date will be available the same day as the Switch 2 launches.

  • Mario Kart World
  • Hades 2 (2025)
  • Elden Ring (2025)
  • Street Fighter 6
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion (September 5, 2025)
  • Split Fiction
  • Madden NFL
  • EA Sports FC
  • Hogwarts Legacy
  • Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3+4 (Summer 2025
  • Hitman: World of Assassination
  • Project 007 (TBD)
  • Bravely Default
  • Yakuza 0: Director’s Cut
  • Drag x Drive
  • Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment (Winter 2025)
  • Deltarune
  • Borderlands 4
  • Civilization 7
  • WWE 2K (TBD)
  • NBA 2K (TBD)
  • Two Point Museum (2025)
  • Survival Kids
  • Enter the Gungeon 2 (TBD)
  • Starseeker: Astroneer Expeditions (2026)
  • Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition
  • Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade (TBD)
  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess
  • Hollow Knight: Silksong (2025)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar (August 27, 2025)
  • Goodnight Universe (2025)
  • WILD HEARTS S (July 25, 2025)
  • Witchbrook (Holiday 2025)
  • Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma
  • Marvel Cosmic Invastion (Holiday 2025)
  • Star Wars Outlaws (2025)
  • Nobunaga’s Ambition: Awakening Complete Edition
  • Fast Fusion
  • Shadow Labyrinth (July 18, 2025)
  • RAIDOU Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army (June 19, 2025)
  • No Sleep For Kaname Date – From AI: THE SOMNIUM FILES (July 25, 2025)
  • REANIMAL (2025)
  • Fortnite
  • Arcade Archives 2 RIDGE RACER
  • Professor Layton and the New World of Steam (2025)
  • Tamagotchi Plaza (June 27, 2025)
  • Human Fall Flat 2
  • The Duskbloods (2026)
  • Kirby Air Riders (2025)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza (July 17, 2025)

Nintendo Switch Games “Enhanced” For Nintendo Switch 2

Here is a list of the Nintendo Switch Games that will have “enhanced” versions on the Nintendo Switch 2. Some of these enhancements will require the player to pay a small upgrade price.

  • Super Mario Party Jamboree
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star Crossed World
  • Metroid Prime 4 Beyond
  • Pokemon Legends Z-A

Gamecube Games Coming to Nintendo Switch Online

The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, SOULCALIBUR 2, and F-ZERO GX will be available when the Switch 2 launches. The other Gamecube titles listed will be added at a later time.

  • The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker
  • SOULCALIBUR 2
  • F-ZERO GX
  • Super Mario Sunshine
  • Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance
  • Pokemon XD: Gale of Darkness
  • Super Mario Strikers
  • Chibi-Robo
  • Luigi’s Mansion
  • Pokemon Coliseum

Which Nintendo Switch 2 games catches your interest the most? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the full details on pre-order in the Nintendo Switch 2. And don’t forget to sign up for the Insider Gaming newsletter.
